description.narrative: The PDO for this project is to assist the Government of the United Republic of Tanzania in improving the equity of geographic access and use of basic health services across districts and enhancing the quality of health services being delivered. This would be achieved by introducing innovative financing mechanisms for health service delivery which encourage both effective and efficient management of health services at the local level and a focus on quality improvement, and would be accomplished within the framework of theHealth Sector Strategic Plan III.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Health and Social Welfare

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, C.4(a) | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Association shall at all timeshave read-only access to the Recipient's central bank's real-time statement of the Special HBF Account | Due Date :02-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, B.1 | Description :The Recipient shall update the Project Implementation Plan in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :02-Jun-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, C.1 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare, and provide to IDA a work plan ofactivities to be included in the Project for the following fiscal year | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, C.3 | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that all Beneficiaries under Part A. andC.1 of the Project produce annual CCHPs and that a summary of the CCHPs is made available | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, C.4(b) | Description :The Recipient shall furnish a statement of the Special HBF Accountto the Association by electronic means | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, E.1 | Description :The Recipient shall make payments to the Beneficiaries for thecarrying out of Subprojects in accordance with criteria and procedures acceptable to the Association set forth in the PIP |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, E.2 | Description :The Recipient shall make each Grant based on a CCHP, or CBG Proposaldeveloped by the respective Beneficiary on terms and conditions approved by the Association | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, G.1 | Description :The Recipient shall appoint external monitoring and evaluation expertsfor third-party appraisal of LGAs compliance with CCHPs, CBG Proposals, and overall performance as regards Performance Indicatorsto be carried out under Part A.1 of the Project. | Due Date :31-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, G.2 | Description :The Recipient shall: (i) cause said experts to carry out annualverifications of LGA's performance with respect to the Performance Indicators; (ii) obtain interim reports of said annualverifications; and (iii) transmit copies of such annual verification to the BFC | Due Date :31-Dec-2014
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, A.1 | Description :The Recipient shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Projectand prepare Project Reports | Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, A.2 | Description :Project completion and sustainability report | Due Date :30-Oct-2016

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV, B.2 | Description :Except for initial advances authorized by the Association based uponexpenditure forecasts for two consecutive calendar quarters consistent with annual work plans as documented in the CCHP, nowithdrawals shall be made for subsequent advances under Category 1 forthe HBF, unless and until a complete accounting of advancesmade to the HBF in the Predecessor Project is provided in a manner satisfact | Due Date :28-Dec-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V, 6 (a) | Description :Mid-term review | Due Date :02-Sep-2014
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V, 6 (c) | Description :Update MOU in a manner satisfactory to IDA | Due Date :02-Jun-2012

title.narrative: Ratio of the 10 best performing LGAs to the 10 worst performing LGAs in indicators 1 through 3
Children receiving a dose of Vitamin A
Average outpatient attendances per capita broken down by LGA
Ratio of the 10 best performing LGA's to the 10 worst performing LGAs in IND3 (Per capita outpatient)
Ratio of the 10 best performing LGA's to the 10 worst performing LGAs in IND2 (OP per clinician)
Average outpatient attendances per clinical staff broken down by LGA
Births attended in health facility broken down by LGA
Council Health Services Boards (CHSB) that meet on a quarterly basis
Ratio of the 10 best performing LGA's to the 10 worst performing LGAs in IND1 (Births attended)
Health facilities with any stockouts of tracer medicines and vaccines according to CCHP
Health centers in each LGA that provide emergency obstetrical care (EMOC)
Regional Health Management Teams that have implemented performance monitoring and verification initiatives
Use of performance and equity indicators in LGA allocations and use of the approach developed under this project for service delivery grants in other sectors
LGAs which have implemented the new DMIS system
LGAs which have implemented one or more community or social accountability mechanisms
Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
